title: Mastering Cell Structure and Function: Game-Based Blended Learning

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level basic life science knowledge
context.additional_context: A life science foundational competency enhancement program for working professionals, combining smartphone-based game learning activities with offline workshops

learning_goals: Learners can explain the structure and function of cellular components (cell membrane, mitochondria, etc.) with 90% accuracy
Learners can apply and explain the principles of interactions between organelles with over 85% accuracy through game-based learning
Learners can achieve over 80 points in problem-solving abilities related to cell structure and function in summative assessments

resources: Google Sheets-Based Digital Board Game 'Monocelly' Mobile Version
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
